eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PlatformerCharacterAnimator
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Change animations and horizontal flipping of a platformer character automatically.
description: Automatically change the animations and horizontal flipping of a platformer character based on movement and interaction with platform objects.
The platformer example uses this extension ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://platformer)).

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: IdleTracker
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Check if an object has not moved (with some, customizable, tolerance) for a certain duration (1 second by default).
description: This behavior tracks the object position and provides a condition to check if the object has been around the same position for a certain amount of time. It's useful to track objects that are not moving (or very little, at least staying around a position).
To use:
* Add the behavior to your object.
* Configure the distance tolerance and the amount of time before considering objects idle.
* Use the conditions in your events to know when the object is idle (or when it has just moved).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Check if an object has not moved (with some tolerance, 20 pixels by default) for a certain duration (1 second by default).
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: IdleTracker

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object has just moved from its last position (using the tolerance configured in the behavior).
eventsFunctions.fullName: Has just moved from last position
eventsFunctions.name: HasMovedFromLastPosition
eventsFunctions.sentence: _PARAM0_ has moved from its last position

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object is idle: it has not moved from its last position (or within the tolerance) for the time configured in the behavior.
eventsFunctions.name: IsIdle

propertyDescriptors.label: Time, in seconds, before considering the object as idle
propertyDescriptors.name: DurationBeforeIdle

propertyDescriptors.label: Distance, in pixels, allowed for the object to travel and still be considered idle
propertyDescriptors.name: IdleDistanceTolerance

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Entropy
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: AdvancedJump
eventsFunctionsExtensions.previewIconUrl: https://resources.gdevelop-app.com/assets/Icons/Line Hero Pack/Master/SVG/Sports and Fitness/Sports and Fitness_training_running_run.svg
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Let platformer characters: air jump, wall jump wall sliding, coyote time and dashing.
description: This extension provides behaviors to:
* Jump in mid-air
* Jump and slide against walls
* Dash horizontally
* Dash toward the floor

* Do coyote time, also known as "ledge tolerance". It lets players jumping even after their character is no longer touching the ground for a given amount of time. It aims to give players a feeling of control and reduce frustration.
An example allows to check it out ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://platformer-moves)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Let platformer characters jump shortly after leaving a platform and also jump in mid-air.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: AdvancedJump

events.comment: Avoid any side effect if the feature is not used.
The timeframe is starting.
The timeframe is missed.
Coyote jump
The new value will be used next frame.
While in the coyote jump frame, the Object is treated as being on the floor. No air jump can happen.
When the object fall, it doesn't jump but air jumps must be allowed

The order of these events is important because the idle state is:
on the floor and jump key released but the 1st jump must not count.
Reset air jump counter.
Allow air jumps.
Coyote time was disabled, so WasInTheAir may not have been updated for a long time.

events.comment: Avoid a jump from the floor to do a wall jump because of the allowed timeframe.
Reset default character configuration when a jump that is not a wall jump happens (for instance an air jump).
To know when jumping from the floor or not.
Reset default character configuration when the character change of direction or start to fall.
When the character tries to move but can't actually move, it's against a wall.
Save the previous position for the wall detection.

To be permissive, when the jump key was pressed right before the character touch the wall,
it is still detected as a wall jump which reset the air jump counter.

events.comment: This allows to detect a change of "intial value" on hot reload.
Create the child-object instances.
Pass the configuration to the behavior (MaxValue must be set before Value).

Children instances must be resized when the button size change:
- background is resized to take the full dimensions of the button
- the bar size is refreshed according to the value

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

- the label is put back at the center of the bar

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Health
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Manage health points and damage, including a protective shield and armor.
description: Manage health points including a protective shield and armor. Health can be assigned to players, enemies, NPCs, or even inanimate objects such as breaking doors and mining rocks.
Damage calculations are performed in this order:
Incoming Damage -> Is Damage Cooldown active? -> Chance to Dodge -> Flat Damage Reduction -> Percent Damage Reduction -> Damage to Shield -> Damage to Health
How to use:
- Set desired values in behavior properties
- To apply damage use Apply damage to an object
- To heal health, use Heal object action
- To activate the shield, use Activate shield action
- Health and shield regeneration will happen automatically based on properties
Tips:
- While damage cooldown is active, no damage will be applied to health or shield (the object is invincible)
- Try using the Blink extension while damage cooldown is active
- Use the Is just damaged or "Is just healed" conditions to trigger sound and visual effects
Health properties:
- Starting health points
- Maximum health points. Use "0" for no maximum
- Damage cooldown (seconds) Use "0" for no cooldown
- Rate of health regeneration (points per second)
- Delay before health regeneration starts after being hit (seconds)
- Allow heals to increase health above max health (regen will never exceed max health)
Shield properties:
- Max shield points. Use "0" for no maximum
- Duration of shield (seconds) Use "0" to make shield permanent
- Rate of shield regeneration (points per second)
- Delay before shield regeneration starts after being hit (seconds)
- Block excess damage when shield is broken (yes/no)
The top-down RPG example uses this extension ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://top-down-rpg)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Manage health (life) points including a protective shield and armor.

No damage will be applied when dodged
If shield is active, damage the shield first
If damage is less than shield, subtract damage from shield.
If damage is greater than shield, conditionally apply excess damage based on property
Apply excess damage only if shield does not block excess damage

eventsFunctions.name: TimeSinceLastHit
eventsFunctions.sentence: the time since last taken hit on health

eventsFunctions.description: the health damage taken from most recent hit.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Health damage taken from most recent hit
eventsFunctions.name: PreviousDamageTaken
eventsFunctions.sentence: the health damage taken from most recent hit

eventsFunctions.description: the maximum shield points of the object.
eventsFunctions.name: MaxShield

eventsFunctions.description: Change the maximum shield points of the object.
eventsFunctions.name: SetMaxShield
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the maximum shield of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ points

eventsFunctions.description: Change maximum shield points.
eventsFunctions.name: SetMaxShieldPoints
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the maximum shield points on _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ points

eventsFunctions.description: the current shield points of the object.
eventsFunctions.name: ShieldPoints

eventsFunctions.description: Change current shield points. Will not trigger damage cooldown.
eventsFunctions.name: SetShieldPoints
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change current shield points on _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ points

eventsFunctions.description: the rate of shield regeneration (points per second).
eventsFunctions.name: ShieldRegenRate

eventsFunctions.description: Change rate of shield regeneration.
eventsFunctions.name: SetShieldRegenRate
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the shield regeneration rate of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ points per second

eventsFunctions.description: the delay before shield regeneration starts after being hit (seconds).
eventsFunctions.name: ShieldRegenDelay

eventsFunctions.description: Change delay before shield regeneration starts after being hit.
eventsFunctions.name: SetShieldRegenDelay
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the shield regeneration delay on _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ seconds

eventsFunctions.description: the duration of the shield (seconds). A value of "0" means the shield is permanent.
eventsFunctions.name: ShieldDuration

eventsFunctions.description: Change duration of shield. Use "0" to make shield permanent.
eventsFunctions.name: SetShieldDuration
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the duration of shield on _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ seconds

eventsFunctions.description: Renew shield duration to it's full value.
eventsFunctions.name: RenewShieldDuration

eventsFunctions.description: Activate the shield by setting the shield points and renewing the shield duration (optional).
eventsFunctions.name: ActivateShield
eventsFunctions.sentence: Activate the shield on _PARAM0_ with _PARAM2_ points (Renew shield duration: _PARAM3_)

eventsFunctions.description: Enable (or disable) blocking excess damage when shield breaks.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Block excess damage when shield breaks
eventsFunctions.name: SetShieldBlockExcessDamage
eventsFunctions.sentence: Shield on _PARAM0_ blocks excess damage when it breaks: _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the shield was just damaged previously in the events.
eventsFunctions.name: IsShieldJustDamaged
eventsFunctions.sentence: Shield on _PARAM0_ has just been damaged

eventsFunctions.description: Check if incoming damage was just dodged.
eventsFunctions.name: IsJustDodged

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the shield is active (based on shield points and duration).
eventsFunctions.name: IsShieldActive

events.comment: To be considered "active", a shield must have positive points AND not exceed duration
Don't check the timer when duration is zero (or negative)

eventsFunctions.description: the time before the shield duration ends (seconds).
eventsFunctions.name: ShieldTimeRemaining
eventsFunctions.sentence: the time before the shield duration end

eventsFunctions.description: the shield damage taken from most recent hit.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Shield damage taken from most recent hit
eventsFunctions.name: PreviousDamageToShield
eventsFunctions.sentence: the shield damage taken from most recent hit

eventsFunctions.description: the health points gained from previous heal.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Health points gained from previous heal
eventsFunctions.name: PreviousHealAmount
eventsFunctions.sentence: the health points gained from previous heal

propertyDescriptors.label: Maximum health (points) Use "0" for no maximum
propertyDescriptors.name: MaxHealth

propertyDescriptors.label: Rate of health regeneration (points per second)
propertyDescriptors.name: HealthRegenRate

propertyDescriptors.label: Delay before health regeneration starts after being hit
propertyDescriptors.name: HealthRegenDelay

propertyDescriptors.label: Allow heals to increase health above max health (regen will never exceed max health)
propertyDescriptors.name: AllowOverHealing

propertyDescriptors.label: Duration of shield
propertyDescriptors.description: Use "0" to make the shield permanent.
propertyDescriptors.name: ShieldDuration

propertyDescriptors.label: Rate of shield regeneration (points per second)
propertyDescriptors.name: ShieldRegenRate

propertyDescriptors.label: Block excess damage when shield is broken
propertyDescriptors.name: BlockExcessDamage

propertyDescriptors.label: Delay before shield regeneration starts after being hit
propertyDescriptors.name: ShieldRegenDelay

propertyDescriptors.label: Chance to dodge incoming damage (Range: 0 to 1)
propertyDescriptors.description: When a damage is dodged, no damage is applied.
propertyDescriptors.name: ChanceToDodge

propertyDescriptors.label: Damage to health from the previous incoming damage
propertyDescriptors.name: DamageToBeApplied

propertyDescriptors.label: Flat damage reduction from armor
propertyDescriptors.description: Incoming damages are reduced by this value.
propertyDescriptors.name: FlatDamageReduction

propertyDescriptors.label: Percentage damage reduction from armor (Range: 0 to 1)
propertyDescriptors.name: PercentDamageReduction

propertyDescriptors.label: Damage to shield from the previous incoming damage
propertyDescriptors.name: ShieldDamageTaken

propertyDescriptors.label: Health points gained from the previous heal
propertyDescriptors.name: HealToBeApplied
